Steps to reproduce:
1) get RCP browser sample from head.
2) add a valid intro definition. something like this :
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.intro">  
      <introProductBinding        	
introId="yourIntroId"
            	productId="org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser.product">
      	</introProductBinding>
   </extension>  

3) add Welcome menu to the RCP Help menu: in action builder class: 
welcomeAction = ActionFactory.INTRO.create(window); 

4) Self host, but select running an application (browser app), not a product.

5) run, you will get : 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.IntroAction.getImageDescriptor
(IntroAction.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.updateImages
(ActionContributionItem.java:959)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.update
(ActionContributionItem.java:826)

In the workbench class, the introDescriptor is null because there is not 
product, and so getting the image gives NPE. 
But what I dont understand is that when I do the same steps with the workbench 
org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench app, it works, and the menu that appears is the 
old legacy welcome menu.

The IDE app checks to see if there is an intro before adding the action.  I'm
torn between marking this as wontfix and doing something wonky in the
IntroAction constructor to sabotage its usage in the case where there is no intro...

Nick, do you have a preference?

The intro action is exposed as API to other RCP apps via ActionFactory.INTRO.
It should be self-sufficient, and not rely on the particular shape of the menus
in the IDE.
It could just bring up an error dialog, saying there's no product.

Fix comitted.  Nick, the messages are in IntroMessages if you'd like to review
them for RCP friendliness.
*** Bug 90751 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The messages look fine RCP-wise.

Suggest changing:
Intro_could_not_create_descriptor=Unable to create view descriptor.
to:
Intro_could_not_create_descriptor=Unable to create intro view descriptor.
